trans-unit.source: Build a prototype application for Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Build a prototype application for Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Create your first application prototype to get started with Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Create your first application prototype to get started with Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Build a prototype application for Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Build a prototype application for Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Developers who evaluate Azure Search almost always start with a preliminary test application that demonstrates the value of adding Azure Search to a custom application.
trans-unit.target: Developers who evaluate Azure Search almost always start with a preliminary test application that demonstrates the value of adding Azure Search to a custom application.

trans-unit.source: In this article, we give you a few building blocks to speed up the prototyping process.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we give you a few building blocks to speed up the prototyping process.

trans-unit.source: A visual studio C# project that includes data.json and schema.json files.
trans-unit.target: A visual studio C# project that includes data.json and schema.json files.

trans-unit.source: Having sample data lets you immediately build and run the solution, confirming the solution works on your system before you write one line of code.
trans-unit.target: Having sample data lets you immediately build and run the solution, confirming the solution works on your system before you write one line of code.

trans-unit.source: If possible, try to substitute these standalone, disconnected schema and data files with data from your business.
trans-unit.target: If possible, try to substitute these standalone, disconnected schema and data files with data from your business.

trans-unit.source: Then, when you run the application, the index that gets created is based on your schema, and documents based on your data files, will be immediately available to work with in Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Then, when you run the application, the index that gets created is based on your schema, and documents based on your data files, will be immediately available to work with in Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Guidance on how to structure the data you'll upload to Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Guidance on how to structure the data you'll upload to Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: You need one dataset for each index.
trans-unit.target: You need one dataset for each index.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search uses JSON for data serialization.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search uses JSON for data serialization.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, we'll point you to a few additional features that will take your prototype to the next level, incorporating search-specific features like faceted navigation, scoring profiles for tuning results, type-ahead or auto-complete queries, and search page-related functionality that isn't available in strictly full-text search alternative.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, we'll point you to a few additional features that will take your prototype to the next level, incorporating search-specific features like faceted navigation, scoring profiles for tuning results, type-ahead or auto-complete queries, and search page-related functionality that isn't available in strictly full-text search alternative.

trans-unit.source: In the end, you will have a prototype application, using your data, to demonstrate a robust search experience using Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: In the end, you will have a prototype application, using your data, to demonstrate a robust search experience using Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the data
trans-unit.target: Prepare the data

trans-unit.source: Search operations are performed against a search index that you create on Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Search operations are performed against a search index that you create on Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: An index has multiple parts, including scoring profiles and suggesters, but the bulk of an index consists of data fields used in search operations.
trans-unit.target: An index has multiple parts, including scoring profiles and suggesters, but the bulk of an index consists of data fields used in search operations.

trans-unit.source: The dataset providing the fields should be a flat data file (in JSON), where each field in your dataset maps to an equivalent field in the index you are trying to populate.
trans-unit.target: The dataset providing the fields should be a flat data file (in JSON), where each field in your dataset maps to an equivalent field in the index you are trying to populate.

trans-unit.source: Other parts of the index, such as a scoring profile or CORS options, are added independently, directly in the schema.
trans-unit.target: Other parts of the index, such as a scoring profile or CORS options, are added independently, directly in the schema.

trans-unit.source: Data sources that use JSON natively, such as as Azure Table Storage, will provide data that is easier to consume than relational data, you will require a single view or table that provides all fields in one rowset.
trans-unit.target: Data sources that use JSON natively, such as as Azure Table Storage, will provide data that is easier to consume than relational data, you will require a single view or table that provides all fields in one rowset.

trans-unit.source: To upload data and schema files using the code in the prototype sample application, you can overwrite the default schema and data files that are embedded in the solution.
trans-unit.target: To upload data and schema files using the code in the prototype sample application, you can overwrite the default schema and data files that are embedded in the solution.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can load multiple data files, perhaps to upload data in batches, but the structure of the data has to be the same for every data file you upload to the same index.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can load multiple data files, perhaps to upload data in batches, but the structure of the data has to be the same for every data file you upload to the same index.

trans-unit.source: You cannot join indexes; each index functions as a standalone search corpus.
trans-unit.target: You cannot join indexes; each index functions as a standalone search corpus.

trans-unit.source: Test the prototype solution on your system
trans-unit.target: Test the prototype solution on your system

trans-unit.source: [Create an Azure Search service in the Azure portal](search-create-service-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: [Create an Azure Search service in the Azure portal](search-create-service-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: You can add a shared (free) version of the service to any existing Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can add a shared (free) version of the service to any existing Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: The shared service is often used for prototypes.
trans-unit.target: The shared service is often used for prototypes.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that the shared service provides 50 MB of data or 10,000 documents total, whichever comes first.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that the shared service provides 50 MB of data or 10,000 documents total, whichever comes first.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, data and documents can be spread across a maximum of 3 indexes.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, data and documents can be spread across a maximum of 3 indexes.

trans-unit.source: Running the prototype sample application, with the built-in sample data files, will create in one index named "musicstoreindex", containing 246 documents, at 278 KB on your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: Running the prototype sample application, with the built-in sample data files, will create in one index named "musicstoreindex", containing 246 documents, at 278 KB on your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: Later in this walkthrough, you'll replace this index with a new one using Adventure Works data that will consume up to ## documents and ## MB.
trans-unit.target: Later in this walkthrough, you'll replace this index with a new one using Adventure Works data that will consume up to ## documents and ## MB.

trans-unit.source: [Download the prototype builder solution](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=536479).
trans-unit.target: [Download the prototype builder solution](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=536479).

trans-unit.source: This is a Visual Studio 2013 solution in C# that builds a console application used to create, load, and query an index.
trans-unit.target: This is a Visual Studio 2013 solution in C# that builds a console application used to create, load, and query an index.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have Visual Studio, you can get the free [Visual Studio 2013 Express edition](http://www.visualstudio.com/products/visual-studio-express-vs.aspx) version.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have Visual Studio, you can get the free [Visual Studio 2013 Express edition](http://www.visualstudio.com/products/visual-studio-express-vs.aspx) version.

trans-unit.source: Edit app.config to add configuration settings that target your Search service and api-key.
trans-unit.target: Edit app.config to add configuration settings that target your Search service and api-key.

trans-unit.source: You can get the URL and the admin api-key from [service dashboard in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: You can get the URL and the admin api-key from [service dashboard in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: For the URL, type the full path of the service name, including the https prefix and the `search.windows.net` domain.
trans-unit.target: For the URL, type the full path of the service name, including the https prefix and the `search.windows.net` domain.

trans-unit.source: Build the solution to ensure there are no build errors.
trans-unit.target: Build the solution to ensure there are no build errors.

trans-unit.source: You might need to update packages to resolve build errors.
trans-unit.target: You might need to update packages to resolve build errors.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Manage NuGet packages** on the solution to update the packages.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Manage NuGet packages** on the solution to update the packages.

trans-unit.source: Run the solution using the built-in schema and data files.
trans-unit.target: Run the solution using the built-in schema and data files.

trans-unit.source: This step is optional, but it confirms the solution works before you invest any time into adding your own data.
trans-unit.target: This step is optional, but it confirms the solution works before you invest any time into adding your own data.

trans-unit.source: The console outputs the following messages:
trans-unit.target: The console outputs the following messages:

trans-unit.source: Index deleted (occurs only if an index of the name "musicstoreindex" exists)
trans-unit.target: Index deleted (occurs only if an index of the name "musicstoreindex" exists)

trans-unit.source: Index created (a new index named "musicstoreindex" is created in your service)
trans-unit.target: Index created (a new index named "musicstoreindex" is created in your service)

trans-unit.source: Documents posted (one message for each JSON file)
trans-unit.target: Documents posted (one message for each JSON file)

trans-unit.source: Waiting 5 seconds (allows indexing to complete before issuing the first query)
trans-unit.target: Waiting 5 seconds (allows indexing to complete before issuing the first query)

trans-unit.source: Search Results for search term 'best' with no boosting (runs a simple query proving the data is loaded in the index)
trans-unit.target: Search Results for search term 'best' with no boosting (runs a simple query proving the data is loaded in the index)

trans-unit.source: Stop the application and delete the index to make room for yours.
trans-unit.target: Stop the application and delete the index to make room for yours.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] You can use [the portal](https://portal.azure.com) to delete the index.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] You can use [the portal](https://portal.azure.com) to delete the index.

trans-unit.source: Click the index name to open the index blade and use the **Delete** command.
trans-unit.target: Click the index name to open the index blade and use the **Delete** command.

trans-unit.source: Replace the schema and data JSON files with your data
trans-unit.target: Replace the schema and data JSON files with your data

trans-unit.source: In the prototype solution, there is one schema file and three data files: data1.json, data2.json, and data3.json.
trans-unit.target: In the prototype solution, there is one schema file and three data files: data1.json, data2.json, and data3.json.

trans-unit.source: The schema file (schema.json) should be replaced with a schema that describes your data.
trans-unit.target: The schema file (schema.json) should be replaced with a schema that describes your data.

trans-unit.source: By default, these files are located in the solution folder:
trans-unit.target: By default, these files are located in the solution folder:

trans-unit.source: If you can get your data into JSON files, you can overwrite the existing files with your data, and then run the application to create and load an index.
trans-unit.target: If you can get your data into JSON files, you can overwrite the existing files with your data, and then run the application to create and load an index.

trans-unit.source: Distributing data across multiple files helps demonstrate a batch upload operation.
trans-unit.target: Distributing data across multiple files helps demonstrate a batch upload operation.

trans-unit.source: Other approaches for loading data include using an indexer (requires either an Azure DocumentDB data source or an Azure SQL Database data source).
trans-unit.target: Other approaches for loading data include using an indexer (requires either an Azure DocumentDB data source or an Azure SQL Database data source).

trans-unit.source: Sample code that demonstrates additional ways of loading data can be found at [Azure Search Video and Tutorials List](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn818681.aspx) on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: Sample code that demonstrates additional ways of loading data can be found at [Azure Search Video and Tutorials List](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn818681.aspx) on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Edit the query
trans-unit.target: Edit the query

trans-unit.source: The default query built into the solution references fields and structures from the built-in data files.
trans-unit.target: The default query built into the solution references fields and structures from the built-in data files.

trans-unit.source: Once you have overwritten the data files to use your data, you can either comment out the query code or modify it to use fields from your schema.
trans-unit.target: Once you have overwritten the data files to use your data, you can either comment out the query code or modify it to use fields from your schema.

trans-unit.source: For more information on search query syntax, see [Search Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798927.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on search query syntax, see [Search Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798927.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Build and run the application
trans-unit.target: Build and run the application

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the app.

trans-unit.source: As before, you should see messages indicating the index is created, loaded, and queryable.
trans-unit.target: As before, you should see messages indicating the index is created, loaded, and queryable.

trans-unit.source: You now have an operational index which you can use as the basis for further investigation.
trans-unit.target: You now have an operational index which you can use as the basis for further investigation.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you might want to switch to [Fiddler](search-fiddler.md) or [Chrome Postman](search-chrome-postman.md) to run queries, modify any of the sample applications to use your Search service and index, or add custom code that provides data visualization.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you might want to switch to [Fiddler](search-fiddler.md) or [Chrome Postman](search-chrome-postman.md) to run queries, modify any of the sample applications to use your Search service and index, or add custom code that provides data visualization.

trans-unit.source: Add a scoring profile
trans-unit.target: Add a scoring profile

trans-unit.source: We suggest that you experiment with [scoring profiles](search-get-started-scoring-profiles.md) either through the portal or through code.
trans-unit.target: We suggest that you experiment with [scoring profiles](search-get-started-scoring-profiles.md) either through the portal or through code.

trans-unit.source: Scoring profiles boost the importance of a search term being found in a specific field.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profiles boost the importance of a search term being found in a specific field.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the search term is a city name, you would expect documents having *Seattle* in the City field to appear higher in the results than documents having the *Seattle* in a Description field.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the search term is a city name, you would expect documents having *Seattle* in the City field to appear higher in the results than documents having the *Seattle* in a Description field.

trans-unit.source: Adding a scoring profile changes the index; you will need to rebuild and reload the index whenever you modify the schema.
trans-unit.target: Adding a scoring profile changes the index; you will need to rebuild and reload the index whenever you modify the schema.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, consider adding scoring profile code segments to your prototype (or modify scoring profile samples to use your indexing code).
trans-unit.target: For this reason, consider adding scoring profile code segments to your prototype (or modify scoring profile samples to use your indexing code).

trans-unit.source: See [Add a scoring profile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798928.aspx) for the reference documentation on scoring profiles.
trans-unit.target: See [Add a scoring profile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798928.aspx) for the reference documentation on scoring profiles.

trans-unit.source: Add a suggesters
trans-unit.target: Add a suggesters

trans-unit.source: Suggesters refers to the popular search feature that projects a list of possible search terms based on text inputs from the user (typing "wea" prompts a list of autocomplete search terms for "weather", "weather channel", "weather underground", and so forth).
trans-unit.target: Suggesters refers to the popular search feature that projects a list of possible search terms based on text inputs from the user (typing "wea" prompts a list of autocomplete search terms for "weather", "weather channel", "weather underground", and so forth).

trans-unit.source: To add suggesters, add a section to the index schema that specifies which fields are used to build autocomplete or typeahead queries.
trans-unit.target: To add suggesters, add a section to the index schema that specifies which fields are used to build autocomplete or typeahead queries.

trans-unit.source: Fields containing names or shorter strings having non-repetitive values tend to work the best.
trans-unit.target: Fields containing names or shorter strings having non-repetitive values tend to work the best.

trans-unit.source: See [Create Index](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798928.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Create Index](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798928.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Try a language analyzer
trans-unit.target: Try a language analyzer

trans-unit.source: Language analyzers provide the linguistic rules for distinguishing between essential and non-essential words, root forms, and even synonyms.
trans-unit.target: Language analyzers provide the linguistic rules for distinguishing between essential and non-essential words, root forms, and even synonyms.

trans-unit.source: By default, Azure Search uses the Lucene language analyzer for English.
trans-unit.target: By default, Azure Search uses the Lucene language analyzer for English.

trans-unit.source: You can specify different analyzers as an index attribute on specific fields, which allows you to build schemas and documents that include fields using different analyzers (for example, a multilingual application might combine French and English fields side by side in the same document).
trans-unit.target: You can specify different analyzers as an index attribute on specific fields, which allows you to build schemas and documents that include fields using different analyzers (for example, a multilingual application might combine French and English fields side by side in the same document).

trans-unit.source: See [Language Support](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn879793.aspx) for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Language Support](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn879793.aspx) for more details.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the previous sections, you modified the index to add more functionality to your prototype.
trans-unit.target: In the previous sections, you modified the index to add more functionality to your prototype.

trans-unit.source: At this point, your index changes are mostly complete (we didn't cover enabling CORS, which is the only remaining schema change you could make).
trans-unit.target: At this point, your index changes are mostly complete (we didn't cover enabling CORS, which is the only remaining schema change you could make).

trans-unit.source: Further prototyping will now potentially lead you in two different directions: an outward focus on the UI, perhaps adding faceted navigation or other filters that help narrow the search, or further exploration on the data synchronization aspects of your solution.
trans-unit.target: Further prototyping will now potentially lead you in two different directions: an outward focus on the UI, perhaps adding faceted navigation or other filters that help narrow the search, or further exploration on the data synchronization aspects of your solution.

trans-unit.source: Many solutions have volatile data.
trans-unit.target: Many solutions have volatile data.

trans-unit.source: For many developers, synchronizing data updates between transactional database systems and an Azure Search index is the next priority once basic search behaviors are verified.
trans-unit.target: For many developers, synchronizing data updates between transactional database systems and an Azure Search index is the next priority once basic search behaviors are verified.

trans-unit.source: Visit these links to learn more:
trans-unit.target: Visit these links to learn more:

trans-unit.source: Typical workflows for development projects using Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Typical workflows for development projects using Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Azure Search Indexer Customization
trans-unit.target: Azure Search Indexer Customization

trans-unit.source: Faceted navigation in Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Faceted navigation in Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Paging search results in Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Paging search results in Azure Search
